**Text: 'Working from Home'**

Georgina McGuiness took a long break from her job as a journalist. She felt lost because of new technology. In this story, she shares how she changed her home into a good place to work.

Last Christmas, I turned 37 years old. I realized I needed to get back to my job in journalism. I looked at my resume and saw that I was stuck in the past. I used to type on a typewriter, and now computers were everywhere. I thought no one would want me in a newsroom because I did not know how to use a computer. Many job ads asked for experience in desktop publishing, but I had none. I felt scared to use a computer. Even using a calculator was hard for me.

I knew I had to learn quickly. I thought it would be hard to leave home before my kids went to school. Then, I entered a contest in a local newspaper. To my surprise, my family won a computer! We got a laptop for my husband and a personal computer for us all. We started to learn about the Internet and how to chat with people from around the world. My kids loved using the computer, and I set up a small office in the kitchen. I had a phone, a fax machine, and a modem to connect to the Internet. I could work from home and still take my kids to school.

My children were good with computers, but I was nervous. I thought I would lose my work if I pressed the wrong button. But I learned the basic skills I needed. It was easier than I thought. I started writing articles for a magazine, and now I feel happy that I can work from home.

The computer helped me a lot. Before, my desk was always messy, and I lost important papers. Now, I am more organized. I can keep track of money and use templates for letters and invoices. The Internet helps me find information for my stories and talk to other writers.

However, working from home has some problems. I can feel lonely because I do not see many people. There are also distractions at home, like chores and my kids wanting to use the computer. Many people in my neighborhood are also using computers for work and fun.

A report says that many people who work from home are educated and own personal computers. I feel I am doing well with my computer skills. One day, I hope to send my articles to a newspaper in Australia or even start my own magazine. The possibilities are endless!

**The Tartan Museum**

The Tartan Museum is in Edinburgh, Scotland. It has modern buildings that look like cheese wedges. The museum has a big yellow tower and a garden on the roof. Many people have different opinions about the building. Some think it is beautiful, while others do not like it.

The museum has many interesting things to see. It tells stories about Scotland's history. There are important objects, like jewels from Mary Queen of Scots. The museum wants to be fun and easy to understand for everyone, not just experts.

Dr. David Clarke is in charge of the exhibitions. He wants visitors to enjoy their time at the museum. He believes that the museum should show the truth about the past. There are no fake scenes; everything shown is based on what experts know.

The museum has many spaces to explore. The walls are light, and there are big windows that let in sunlight. Visitors can take their time to look at each item. There is also a special area for children to learn and play.

On the top floor, there is a gallery that changes every three years. It shows objects that are important to Scottish people, like electric guitars and toys. This gallery is fun, but some think it does not deal with serious topics.

Overall, Dr. Clarke believes that objects can tell stories about the past better than anything else. The museum is beautiful inside, but some wonder if it is in the right place.

For example, The Daily Telegraph and The Guardian have seen a drop in print sales of about 8% to 10% each year, but their websites are getting more visitors.

However, not everything is clear. A survey showed that the total number of newspapers sold around the world went up by 1.1% last year. In some places, like Asia, sales increased. Some magazines also saw a rise in sales of 5.4%. 

When it comes to books, e-readers like Kindle are very popular. But when bookstores looked at their sales of physical books, they found that sales were only down by 0.4%. This means people still buy both e-books and paper books.

Many people think young people do not read newspapers anymore, but this is not true. The latest survey shows that nearly 5 million people aged 15 to 35 read national newspapers. Different countries have different trends. In Britain, print sales have dropped by 10.8%, but in Germany, the drop is only 7%. In France, it is just 3.1%.

Some experts thought that online ads would help newspapers make money, but now online ads are going down. Many US newspapers have started to charge for online access. The best way to get readers is to offer both print and online access together. 

Print newspapers are still important for selling online subscriptions. They make much more money from print ads than from online ads. However, it is hard for newspapers to keep both print and online versions running. But print newspapers still have a strong presence, while it is harder to be noticed online.

**Simplified Text: Photographing People**

People are very interesting to photograph. A photo with a person is usually better than one without. But taking good photos of people can be hard. The photographer must pay attention to how people move and what they show on their faces. Sometimes, just having a camera can make people act differently.

A. **Grouping People**  
When taking a photo of a group, do not line people up in a straight line. Ask them to stand at different angles and distances. Some can sit or kneel in front so you can see all their faces.

B. **Posing for Pictures**  
People often feel stiff in front of a camera. Help them relax by suggesting they find a comfortable position, like folding their hands or putting them in their pockets.

C. **The Right Approach**  
Do not pretend you are not taking a picture when it is clear you are. Most people will agree to have their picture taken, but they may feel shy. You might need to help them feel comfortable. A photo can be less interesting if the person looks away from the camera.

D. **Eye Contact**  
A photo looks better if the person looks at the camera. Ask them to look into the lens. They do not have to smile. If they look away, remind them just before you take the picture. You can also say something funny to get a real reaction.

E. **Candid Concentration**  
Instead of looking at the camera, the person can look at something else in the picture. This can make the photo feel more natural. Candid shots can be very interesting.

F. **Expressions and Gestures**  
The way a person looks and moves tells us a lot about them. A laughing child can make us smile, while a sad face can make us feel sad. Look for different expressions like smiles, frowns, or thumbs-up.

G. **Situation Interest**  
The background of a photo can add more interest. Make sure the background does not take attention away from the person. Use a camera that can focus on the person and blur the background.

H. **Interaction**  
Good photos can happen when people are talking, laughing, or working together. Look for moments when people connect, like a handshake or a smile.

I. **People and Places**  
Many photos of people are taken on trips. To show both the people and the place, step back to get everything in the picture. Make sure the people are close enough to be seen clearly.

J. **To Pose or Not to Pose?**  
Think about why you want to take the picture. If you want to remember someone, ask them to pose nicely. But for family photos, candid shots of fun moments are often better than stiff poses. A spontaneous picture can bring back good memories later.

**Text: 'Under Sarah's Spell'**

Sarah Janson is an artist. She paints in a style called trompe-l'oeil. This style makes paintings look real. In this interview, Joanna Watt talks to Sarah.

Sarah does not sign her paintings unless someone asks her to. She thinks the painting is more important than the artist. She says, "It's not the artist who is important, but the work." Sarah is very humble. She does not like to talk about herself. When asked to take a photo, she covers her face.

After a while, Sarah feels more comfortable. The interview becomes fun and interesting. Sarah has been a trompe-l'oeil artist for sixteen years. Before that, she studied art for two years and worked in a publishing house. She did not like illustration, so she started working with a decorator named Jim Smart. He asked her to create one trompe-l'oeil painting, and she loved it. She decided to work on her own.

Sarah believes that you cannot learn trompe-l'oeil from a school. She says, "Trompe-l'oeil is the school of life. It's all about observation." She is always learning. She admits she is not good at painting bread and has trouble with math. Once, she was confused about measurements for a big project at Lulworth Castle. She thought, "You're not Michelangelo. Who do you think you are?"

Sarah often talks about herself in the third person. She says, "When I finished that ceiling, I thought, 'Well, I didn't do it, she did.'" Her trompe-l'oeil paintings are very special. Many people want her work, and she has done many important projects. 

Some of her paintings are inspired by buildings. For example, she created a trompe-l'oeil dining room that looks like a Venetian palace. She also painted a hallway that looks like it has two more rooms. 

Sarah knows that trompe-l'oeil must do two things. First, it must trick the viewer. Second, it must keep the viewer's attention. She believes that the art should also be personal to the client. She enjoys working with her clients and listening to their ideas. Many of her clients become friends because she spends a lot of time with them.

Sarah is thankful for her clients. She says, "I am very grateful for the mad ones who have let me loose on their walls." They are happy with her work, which is why she is always busy. She does not like to brag about herself. She says, "I really don't like to shout about myself." 

Sarah believes that art should not be loud. She thinks you can get bored with things that shout. But you can never get bored with Sarah or her work. Her art deserves to be known more, and I want to share it with others.

**Emotional Intelligence - The Key to Success**

Daniel Goleman talks about the 'people skills' that are important for success at work.

A. The rules for work are changing. We are not only judged by how smart we are or by our training, but also by how well we manage ourselves and work with others. This new way of judging is used to decide who gets hired and who does not. It helps to show who will do well at work and who may not. These new rules are important for our future jobs. They are different from what we learned in school. Doing well in tests is not as important anymore. Now, it is more about social skills and personal qualities, like being friendly, understanding others, and being able to adapt. These skills are called emotional intelligence.

B. Today, many jobs do not offer security. Instead of having one job, people need to have 'portable skills' that they can use in different jobs. Personal qualities are becoming more important at work. Emotional intelligence is the ability to understand and manage our own feelings and the feelings of others. In our work, it includes being aware of ourselves, controlling our emotions, being motivated, understanding others, and having good social skills. Some people think emotional intelligence just means being nice, but it can also mean being honest, even when it is hard. It is not about showing all our feelings, but about managing them so we can work well together.

C. More businesses are realizing that emotional intelligence is very important for good management. The more complicated the job, the more emotional intelligence matters. If someone lacks these skills, it can make it hard for them to use their knowledge and skills. Many people have succeeded without strong emotional intelligence, but as work becomes more complex, companies that work well together have an advantage. In today’s workplace, where teamwork and good customer service are important, emotional intelligence is essential for doing well in any job.

D. Unlike IQ, which does not change much, emotional intelligence can grow as we learn from our experiences. Studies show that most people get better at managing their emotions and understanding others over time. This growth in emotional intelligence is called maturity. We can learn these skills and use them to help us in our jobs. This is important now, as having a stable job is not always possible. Emotional intelligence is not a magic solution for companies, but if we ignore the human side of work, nothing else will work as well.

Social media has changed how people share these pictures. Now, some journalists look at social media for images when news happens quickly. But some reporters use pictures from users without asking for permission. There are rules that say images on social media can be used without permission in special cases or if it is very important to the public. People still talk about whether this is right or wrong. Research shows that about one in ten people would take pictures or videos of a news event. This means user-generated content (UGC) is important for the future of the media. However, to keep a good relationship with the public, the media should make sure that people are paid for their work and that they always ask for permission.'

**Acupuncture and Traditional Chinese Medicine**

Acupuncture is a type of medicine from China that is over 2,000 years old. It is part of traditional Chinese medicine, which also includes herbs, massage, diet, and exercise. Acupuncture is often used to help with pain. Many doctors, midwives, and physiotherapists in the West use it for this purpose.

**What is Traditional Chinese Medicine?**

In traditional Chinese medicine, health means that the mind, body, and spirit are in balance. There is a special energy called Qi (pronounced "chee") that flows in the body along paths called meridians. There are twelve main meridians connected to organs in the body. If the flow of Qi is blocked or weak, a person may feel weak or sick. An acupuncturist checks the flow of Qi by feeling pulses on the wrist, looking at the tongue, and asking about health and habits. They use very thin needles to help the Qi flow better.

**Acupuncture Points**

Acupuncture points are connected to the meridians and may not be near the area that hurts. People often feel a gentle ache or tingling when the needle is used. There are over 300 acupuncture points on the main meridians.

**How Does Acupuncture Work?**

Doctors in the West believe that acupuncture can help with pain, even if they do not follow traditional Chinese medicine. They think that acupuncture can block pain signals or release natural pain-relieving substances in the body.

**What Pain Can Acupuncture Help?**

Many people with long-term pain try acupuncture when other treatments do not work. It can help with back pain, arthritis, headaches, and pain after surgery. Acupuncturists also say it can help with menstrual pain and pain from serious illnesses.

**Using Acupuncture in Surgery**

Acupuncture has been used in China for a long time, but using it instead of anesthesia during surgery started in the 1950s. In China, acupuncture is used in many types of surgeries. Some people say it helps reduce pain without the side effects of regular anesthesia.

**Is Acupuncture Always Effective?**

Studies show that 50 to 80 percent of people find acupuncture helps with chronic pain. Acupuncturists say it usually takes six to seven visits to feel real relief, but some people feel better after just two or three visits.

**A Different Way to Treat Pain**

Acupuncturists look at the whole person, not just the pain. They ask many questions to understand the pain better. They want to know if the pain feels sharp or dull and if it gets worse in certain weather. This information helps them decide how to treat the pain.

**Choosing an Acupuncturist**

Some doctors have training in traditional acupuncture, while others use scientific methods. It is important to choose a good acupuncturist. If needed, they should refer you to a medical doctor for more help.

**Chewing Gum Culture**

Chewing gum is popular in America. People chew 12 million sticks of gum every day. It is a big business. Chewing gum has less than ten calories in each stick. It is a food and must follow rules from the American Food and Drug Administration.

Today, most gum is made with synthetic materials. These materials help keep the flavor and make the gum soft. Long ago, the ancient Greeks chewed a gum-like substance from the mastic tree, which grows in Greece and Turkey. Greek women used mastic gum to clean their teeth and make their breath fresh.

American colonists learned to chew gum from the Native Americans in New England. They chewed resin from spruce trees. In the early 1800s, people sold spruce gum in the eastern United States. This was the first commercial chewing gum in the country.

Modern chewing gum started in the late 1860s with chicle, a substance from the sapodilla tree in Central America. Gum made from chicle was smoother and more enjoyable to chew. However, it is hard to grow sapodilla trees. Because of this, companies now use synthetic materials to make gum.

Today, there are few chicle gatherers, called chicleros. They work hard to collect chicle from trees. They face many dangers, like poisonous snakes and insects. Chicleros climb trees to collect the sap and carry it to a camp. At the camp, they boil the sap until it becomes sticky and make it into bricks.

Life for chicleros is difficult. They eat a simple diet and drink local alcohol. Even though their work is hard, chicleros worry about losing their jobs. Not long ago, the United States imported 7,000 tonnes of chicle each year from Central America. Last year, only 200 tonnes were collected in Mexico.

As chewing gum sales have increased, companies have turned to synthetic materials to save money. Gum makers also find new ways to sell their products. They say gum can help you relax, give you energy, and reduce tooth decay. Chewing gum can help your mouth produce more saliva, which protects your teeth.

Research is ongoing to create new flavors and textures for gum. Most new flavors are artificial, but some still use natural ingredients. In America, a large area is used to grow mint for the two most popular chewing gums in the world.

The hotel also has special technology for business guests. Each room has three phones, two phone lines, a fax machine, and a video-conferencing system. The hotel is ready for new technology, so they have extra cables for future upgrades. They rent televisions and DVD recorders, so they can change them for newer models.

The hotel has 145 comfortable and welcoming rooms. There is a swimming pool, a gym, six conference rooms, two bars, two restaurants, and a beautiful garden. The food is excellent. Chef Patrick Guilbaud, who has two Michelin stars, has moved his restaurant to the Merrion. He has a new kitchen and better parking.

With good technology and staff, the Merrion Hotel is likely to be very successful.

Many trees in Brackham fell down in the strong storms in March. The town lost two big lime trees from the old market square. This change made the town look very different, and some people were not happy about it. One of these people was Chief Inspector Douglas Pelham, who was the head of the local police. But during the storm, Pelham was very sick with bronchitis. He had a headache and a tight chest. His wife, Molly, wanted him to see a doctor, but he did not want to go. He thought the police needed him. 

Finally, his colleague, Sergeant Lloyd, took him to the doctor. Pelham was too weak to argue. Soon, he got medicine and went home. Molly sent him to bed. On Thursday morning, Molly told him that the walnut tree in their garden had fallen down. Pelham was surprised. On Thursday evening, he asked if the house was damaged. He was happy to hear it was not, and he went back to bed.

On Saturday, Pelham felt better. He got up and saw that the living room looked different without the walnut tree. Their big house had a nice garden, and Pelham liked it. The garden made them feel private. Before, the walnut tree made the living room look nice with light and shadow. But now, without the tree, the room was too bright, and the old furniture looked bad. 

The view from the window was not nice either. The tall house next door, which the tree had hidden, was now visible. It had ugly purple bricks and many windows that seemed to watch the Pelhams. 

“Doesn’t it look terrible?” Pelham said to Molly. But Molly, standing in the doorway, seemed happy. “I have been saying this since we moved here. We need to buy a new sofa, no matter the cost.”

**Text: Living in the Valley**

We lived in our valley for sixteen months when we first saw the dangers in the hills around us. It was the year when the storms came early, before winter started. Until then, we felt safe in our valley below the hills. Soon, snow began to fall. In one day, it was about 15 centimeters deep. The snow almost blocked our road and made the path by the stream slippery. 

In the hills, the snow was much deeper and stayed longer. The wind was very strong up there. In our valley, we felt only small gusts of wind; the trees moved but did not break. We knew we should worry. The snow and wind were annoying, but they did not really scare us. The river, called the Ryburn, was what worried us the most. It usually flowed gently, but we remembered what could happen if the water from the hills was not controlled by dams.

Soon, the snow started to melt. Every day, we saw dark clouds gather over the hills. These clouds warned us of what was coming. We watched the river, which was getting fuller and wilder. The snow melted as more rain fell from the clouds, and the reservoir in the hills was filling up quickly. Then it happened - the reservoir overflowed for the first time in years. The water rushed over the dam like a waterfall and poured into the stream below. 

The river looked wild as the water rushed down. Just a few meters from our cottage, the stream was deeper than we had ever seen. For three days, we hoped it would stay below its banks. Luckily, the dam held, and the water began to go down. 

In the past, the river had flooded nearby villages many times. Now, the dam controls the river, and usually, everything is fine. The water from the hills stays behind the dam, and we can enjoy the big clouds above the valley. Thanks to this dam, we feel safe in our home in the valley.

**Text: No Title**

We always went to Ireland in June. Since we started going on holidays together, we spent the first two weeks of June at Glencorn Lodge in County Antrim. It is a big house by the sea, not far from the village of Ardbeag. The Malseeds, an English couple, bought the house and made it bigger, but they did it carefully. Strafe found Glencorn for us. He saw an advertisement when the Malseeds were still advertising. 

"How about this?" he said one evening and read the details. The summer before, we went to a hotel that friends recommended, but it was not good because the food was terrible. The four of us have been playing cards together for a long time: Dekko, Strafe, Cynthia, and me. They call me Milly, but my real name is Dorothy Milson. Dekko got his nickname at school. He and Strafe were in the same school, so we call Strafe by his last name like the teachers did. We are all about the same age and live close to where the Malseeds lived before moving to Ireland. 

"How very nice," Mrs. Malseed said, smiling to welcome us again this year. She seems to know when guests are coming because she is usually waiting in the big hall that smells of flowers. "Arthur, take the luggage up," she told the old porter. "Rose, Tulip, Lily, and Geranium," she said, naming the rooms for us. Mrs. Malseed painted flowers on the doors instead of using numbers. In winter, when few people come to Glencorn Lodge, she takes care of little things like that; her husband does repairs and redecorating. 

"Well, well, well," Mr. Malseed said, coming into the hall from the kitchen. "A hundred thousand welcomes," he greeted us in the Irish way. He was smiling, making us feel special. Everyone smiled, and I could feel that our holiday had truly begun. Nothing had changed at Glencorn; everything was good. Kitty from the dining room came out to greet us. "You look younger every year, all four of you," she said, making everyone laugh again. 

Arthur led the way to our rooms, carrying as much luggage as he could and coming back for the rest. After dinner, we played cards for a while but not for too long because we were still tired from the journey. In the lounge, there was a man alone and a French couple. There were other people at dinner because Glencorn Lodge is always full in June. From our table by the window, we could see some people walking on the lawns and others going down to the beach. 

In the morning, we would walk along the sand to Ardbeag and have coffee at the hotel there, back in time for lunch. In the afternoon, we would drive somewhere. I knew this because we had done it many times before. Since we first came here, we all fell in love with the beautiful landscape.

**Text: Keeping Holiday-Makers Happy**

Sarah Sutherland-Pilch is a chalet girl. She is 24 years old and comes from West Sussex, England. Sarah works in Val d'Isere, France. She cooks and cleans for visitors who come to ski and stay in wooden houses called chalets.

This is Sarah's second year as a chalet girl. She studied French and History of Art at university. Sarah says being a chalet girl is not a career, but it is a fun way to spend a year or two. She meets many interesting people.

Sarah does not live in the chalet. She wakes up at 7 a.m. and walks about a mile to work. The chalet can have up to 18 guests each week. She eats her breakfast first, then makes breakfast for the guests. They have porridge, eggs, cereals, fruit, and croissants.

After breakfast, Sarah cleans up and either makes afternoon tea or cleans the rooms. She thinks cleaning is the worst part of her job. By 11 a.m., she goes skiing. On good days, she can ski until 4:30 p.m.

Sarah comes back to the chalet to prepare dinner. Dinner is served at 8 p.m., and coffee is ready by 10 p.m. After dinner, she cleans the kitchen. Sometimes she talks with the guests, but sometimes they want to be alone. Good guests can make her week better.

Sarah lives in the chalet with her friends. They go out at about 11 p.m. on some nights. They visit different places to have fun. But on Saturday nights, she does not stay out too late because Sunday is her busiest day.

On Sunday, she starts work early. Breakfast for guests leaving has to be ready by 7 a.m. After the guests leave, Sarah cleans quickly. She prepares tea for the new guests who arrive at about 4:30 p.m. Sometimes the new guests have many questions.

Between tea and dinner, Sarah helps guests who need boots or skis. Then she gets a ride back to the chalet. After dinner, she might have a drink, but sometimes she is too tired and goes to bed early.

Seymour was surprised that she was studying at the University of Pennsylvania and doing research about leather in New Jersey for her Master's degree.

Sometimes, he would help students by answering their questions or giving them a short tour if they seemed serious. He said, "They come to the tannery. We buy the material, and they make it ready for us. My grandfather and father worked in the tannery here. I worked there for six months when I started."

Seymour said, "My father knows a lot about leather. You should talk to him. He can talk for two days about gloves. Glovemen love their work. Have you ever seen anything being made, Miss Cohen?" Rita answered, "No, I have not." Seymour laughed and said, "You have never seen anything made?" Rita replied, "I saw my mother make a cake when I was a child." 

Seymour found her funny and liked her spirit. His daughter was much taller than Rita, but Rita reminded him of Marie. She had a bright mind and remembered everything she learned in school. Seymour said, "We will show you how to make gloves. What size do you wear?"

Text: 

In the lumberyard by the lake, there was an old brick building with two floors. Outside, there were big piles of soft sawdust. The sawdust looked like golden mountains and covered the yard down to the blue lake. 

One afternoon, Michael and his friends were bored. They followed Michael up the ladder to the roof of the building. They sat with their legs hanging over the edge and looked at the lake. Suddenly, Michael said, "I dare you to jump down." He jumped off the roof and fell into the sawdust, rolling around and laughing. "I dare you all!" he shouted. "You're all cowards." 

His friends looked down from the roof, scared. But one by one, they jumped down and landed in the sawdust, smiling with relief. They lay on the sawdust pile and told jokes. Then one friend said, "Come on up to the roof again and jump down." 

They were not very excited, but they went up to the roof again. They jumped off quickly until only Michael was left. The others were down below, smiling and calling, "Come on, Mike. What's wrong?" 

Michael wanted to jump down, but he stayed on the edge of the roof, feeling nervous. He tried to count to ten and then jump, but he could not. His friends started to laugh at him. They were tired of waiting, and it was almost dinnertime. "Come on, you're a coward! Do you think we will sit here all night?" they shouted. 

Michael felt sad and alone. He looked at the ground for a long time. The sun was setting, getting bigger and bigger. Finally, he closed his eyes and jumped down into the sawdust. He lay there for a long time. The yard was quiet because the workers had gone home. 

Michael felt ashamed and slowly walked home. He was late for dinner. His stepmother said, "You should be able to get home on time. If you won't come home, you can stay out tonight." She looked serious, but Michael did not hear her. He was thinking about his friends laughing at him.

**Careers Advice**

Are you unhappy in your job? Do you want to change it but don’t know how? Kitty Doherty has some good advice. Many people who want to change their job go to a careers adviser. First, you write a short history of yourself. Then, you take some tests called 'psychometrics'. After the tests, you get a summary of the results and suggestions for different jobs. 

I tried Career Analysts, a big organization that gives career advice. Taking the careers test felt like being in a science exam. I was with about ten other people, and we had to answer questions quickly. I had to remember that it was not about passing or failing. The tests were hard. They included finding mistakes in lists of names and numbers and matching shapes. 

After the tests, I talked with an adviser. He gave me a report with his thoughts and suggestions. I agreed with most of what he said, but I was a little sad to learn that I did not do well in the science and technical tests. I am glad I did not become a nurse! However, it was good to hear that I made the right choices about journalism.

Changing your career does not always mean a big change. Last March, Donna Laney, 25, lost her job as a marketing manager after five years. Her friends told her to go to Career Analysts for help. Donna said, "Losing my job was a good chance to think about my career. I wanted to look at my skills and interests." Some results surprised her. "I did not know I was good at design. But I had to think about the cost of retraining for design," she said. 

Donna also got other ideas, like taking a year off to work in the Far East. In the end, she decided to use her skills and find a job that suited her better than insurance. Now, she works as a Public Relations officer. She believes she could have reached this point without Career Analysts, but they helped her understand what she wanted to do. She has sent many friends there, and they are all happy with the service.

Some people feel they need help to make big changes. Juliet Greene, 26, went to Career Counselling Services after working at a bank for six years. She said, "My job was boring, and I needed a new challenge. I did not know what I wanted to do, so I went to Career Counselling Services with an open mind." After taking the tests, she learned she was interested in sciences. 

Juliet had four meetings with an adviser. The third meeting was recorded, which helped her remember what she said. After the fourth meeting, she decided to study geology and start a degree later this year. She thinks the advice from Career Counselling Services was worth the money. Now, she is much happier.

However, career advice does not work for everyone. Amanda Margetts, 24, a sales representative, said, "I did not know where to go in my career. I thought a careers adviser might suggest something new. I got many new ideas, but I did not like them because they needed a big drop in salary or a lot of retraining. I did not learn anything new about myself." She felt that if she had told a friend the same things, they would have given her similar advice.

**Text: Fun at the Dentist's**

If you go to W. Lloyd Jerome's dental office in Glasgow, you will see bright paintings on the wall and a blue couch. Patients sit on the couch while he checks their teeth. Jerome says, "Many people only go to the dentist when they are in pain. They are scared." To help with this, he wants to make the office a nice place. He does not wear a white coat because many people think that means pain. He believes dental visits should be relaxing and fun.

Jerome uses new ideas to help people feel better. He was the first dentist in Britain to use virtual-reality headsets. Patients wear these headsets during their check-up. They sit on the blue couch and watch a film about underwater animals while Jerome checks their teeth. Then, the headset shows them a view of their mouth.

Most patients like this part of their visit. The office also smells nice, like a perfume shop. Today, it smells like orange. Jerome wants people to feel that this is not a normal dentist's office. The usual dentist smell can make people scared.

Jerome is known as a fashionable dentist, but he takes his work seriously. The relaxation ideas are important, but good treatment is the most important. He uses a special tool that sprays warm water on the teeth to clean them. It feels a little strange, but it is not painful if people are relaxed.

Five years ago, Jerome went to the United States to learn about dental techniques. He found that when it is easier for the patient, it is easier for the dentist too. He wants to change the way dentists work in Britain to be less formal.

One day, a patient arrives. Jerome quickly goes to him, offers tea, asks what video he wants to watch, and leads him to the chair. The patient seems to enjoy this special treatment. The office feels more like a beauty salon than a regular dentist's office.

Chocolate comes from South America. Now, it is a big business around the world. In Britain, people spend over £230 million on chocolate at Easter. This is about eight percent of all chocolate sales in a year. People eat more chocolate at Christmas than at any other time.

The cacao plant, which makes chocolate, was first grown by the Aztecs, Toltecs, and Mayans over three thousand years ago. The cacao tree grows in warm places like Africa, South America, Central America, the West Indies, and South-East Asia. The fruit of the cacao tree is big and has 20-40 seeds inside. When the seeds are dried, they become cacao beans. In English-speaking countries, these are often called cocoa beans. This name is a mistake from the 17th century.

The Aztecs used cocoa beans as money. They also made a drink called xocoatl, which means "bitter water" in their language. The Aztecs added spices to this drink for special occasions. The Spanish liked the drink better with cinnamon and sugar, but it took a long time to become popular in Europe.

In the late 1600s, chocolate houses opened in big cities in Europe. People went there to drink chocolate. Until the last century, people made chocolate drinks from solid chocolate blocks. In 1826, a man named CJ van Houten from the Netherlands made chocolate powder. This was made by taking most of the cocoa butter from the beans. 

In 1847, a company in Bristol called Fry and Sons made the first chocolate bar by mixing cocoa butter, chocolate liquor, and sugar. A Swiss company later added milk to make milk chocolate. At that time, French companies sold most of the chocolate in Britain. In 1879, the English company Cadbury named their factory Bournville to sound French. 

Cadbury then made the Dairy Milk bar in 1905. They advertised it as healthy because it had milk from the English countryside. Now, people in Britain eat about four chocolate bars each week. Chocolate companies are trying to find new ways to sell chocolate. They make chocolate bars into ice cream, drinks, or desserts to attract customers.

Cacao farmers still have problems because cocoa bean prices fell in the late 1980s. Many small farmers lost their businesses. So, think about them when you eat your chocolate bars. 

**Questions:**

1. Where does chocolate come from?
2. How much money do British people spend on chocolate at Easter?
